page.title: 06Crockenhill W.I. and clubs.
page.content: Crockenhill Womens Institute started in 1957 ,the average membership is 60 , ranging in age from 18 to 81.They have a variety of speakers,social time,trading stall and raffle. The WI use the funds and proceeds for various functions,such as an annual senior citizens dinner.The dinner is usually attended by over 100 senior citizens at a total cost about Â£160 ,the meal is a roast with wine , entertainment and a small gift.Members are responsible for collecting for cancer research,RNLI and childrens homes,helping with meals on wheels and looking after the flower beds in the centre of the village.The other caring clubs include Mother and Baby,Darby and Joan,Brownies ,Cubs and British Legion Foresters.
